abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment addresses
            potential adversity on the environment, as a result of the
            Karnataka Watershed Development Project, and proposes the
            following mitigation measures. Soil erosion and water
            drainage will be minimized by reducing gully inflows,
            through vegetative measures. Treatment of the gully system
            should start downstream, to slowly progress upstream, while
            the design of gully control structures should be specific to
            each work site. Likewise, the site for check-dams shall be
            site-specific, to include low slope gully checks, and silt
            basins shall be used for steep slopes, to include silt traps
            of bench types. Vegetative measures may be combined with
            possible cut-off drains to prevent rapid overland flow into
            roadsides, and should as well stabilize erosion on side
            slopes, along with retaining walls. High soil erosion will
            be contained through the installation of stone rip-rap or
            pitching wooden wooden piles. Adequate water catchment areas
            will be located for water harvesting with eco-engineering
            devices, but provisions should be made to trap flowing
            debris and sediment loads located at the inlet for easy
            access for cleaning purposes. Scour protection should be
            provided at the overflow spillway base, where a stone
            pitched channel should conduct excess water from the structure.
